properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.access-key
properties.description: Amazon AWS Access Key

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.amazon-d-d-b-client
properties.description: To use the AmazonDynamoDB as the client. The option is a software.amazon.awssdk.services.dynamodb.DynamoDbClient type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.configuration
properties.description: The component configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.aws2.ddb.Ddb2Configuration type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.consistent-read
properties.description: Determines whether or not strong consistency should be enforced when data is read.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the aws2-ddb component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.key-attribute-name
properties.description: Attribute name when creating table

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.key-attribute-type
properties.description: Attribute type when creating table

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.operation
properties.description: What operation to perform

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.proxy-host
properties.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the DDB client

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.proxy-port
properties.description: The region in which DynamoDB client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.proxy-protocol
properties.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the DDB client

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.read-capacity
properties.description: The provisioned throughput to reserve for reading resources from your table

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.region
properties.description: The region in which DDB client needs to work

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.secret-key
properties.description: Amazon AWS Secret Key

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.trust-all-certificates
properties.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddb.write-capacity
properties.description: The provisioned throughput to reserved for writing resources to your table

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddbstream.access-key
properties.description: Amazon AWS Access Key

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddbstream.amazon-dynamo-db-streams-client
properties.description: Amazon DynamoDB client to use for all requests for this endpoint. The option is a software.amazon.awssdk.services.dynamodb.streams.DynamoDbStreamsClient type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddbstream.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddbstream.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddbstream.configuration
properties.description: The component configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.aws2.ddbstream.Ddb2StreamConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddbstream.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the aws2-ddbstream component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddbstream.iterator-type
properties.description: Defines where in the DynaboDB stream to start getting records. Note that using TRIM_HORIZON can cause a significant delay before the stream has caught up to real-time. if {AT,AFTER}_SEQUENCE_NUMBER are used, then a sequenceNumberProvider MUST be supplied.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddbstream.max-results-per-request
properties.description: Maximum number of records that will be fetched in each poll

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddbstream.proxy-host
properties.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the DDBStreams client

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddbstream.proxy-port
properties.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the DDBStreams client

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddbstream.proxy-protocol
properties.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the DDBStreams client

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddbstream.region
properties.description: The region in which DDBStreams client needs to work

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddbstream.secret-key
properties.description: Amazon AWS Secret Key

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddbstream.sequence-number-provider
properties.description: Provider for the sequence number when using one of the two ShardIteratorType.{AT,AFTER}_SEQUENCE_NUMBER iterator types. Can be a registry reference or a literal sequence number. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.aws2.ddbstream.SequenceNumberProvider type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-ddbstream.trust-all-certificates
properties.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint
